data.title: WP8.1 orientation bug at the start
data.body:
Hi!

when running a WP8.1 game, the orientation is not changed until several frames have passed since the start. It is a quite weird bug, because it seems it depends on the CPU load. It looks really bad because my loading screen is in portrait (while it should be in landscape) for the whole process.

The problem can be reproduced very easily with the spinning cube example: Modify the draw function, and loop 1000 times the whole draw (except clear and base.Draw, of course).

Running the example with a single draw makes the orientation turn as soon as it is started, but with the 1000 times loop, the device takes quite a time to turn orientation.

data.title: Android Soundeffects stop working after calling MediaPlayer.Play
data.body:
Hi,

I seem to have an issue with monogame 3.2 / 3.3.

I had finished my game for windows Phone and it actually is working pretty fine. Now i am porting it to Android and I'm struggling with an issue for a couple of weeks now. Hoping that someone can help me.

First of all both songs and soundeffects/soundeffect instances seem to work when I'm testing on an emulator. When I try it on my acer b1-730hd (Acer Iconia One7) tablet, a strange issue occurs that soundeffects stop working when I start my game. from the main screen which plays an introduction song.

I use Mediaplayer to play mp3 background songs. While playing the game xnb/wav files are used as sound effects.

So when the game starts, a song is being played. When going to the settings screen to adjust sfx volume, you can hear the soundeffect on increasing/decreasing the volume. Then I go back to the main screen. From that point when I either go in game or back to the settings screen, the sound effects are completely gone and only the background music remains. It seems that calling the MediaPlayer.Play() for the second time introduces this issue for me.

In the meanwhile I've tried to downgrade/upgrade to newer versions of monogame, but none seem to fix the issue.

If someone knows what is going on or how to fix it, please let me know.

data.title: Monogame not resuming after coming back from a xaml page.
Renaming an output folder.
data.body:
I would like to be able to select a folder in the treeview and set its 'output folder name' to be something different from its actual name. Eg, change a folder named 'ShadersIOS' to output as 'Shaders'. 

Example usage situation:

Given the following directory structure...

Content.mgcb
ContentIOS.mgcb
Shaders\
Shaders\effect.fx
ShadersIOS\
ShadersIOS\effect.fx

Each platform has its own mgcb file, which includes only the shaders specific to that platform. However at runtime you don't want to have to load "ShadersIOS\effect" you want to load "Shaders\effect". Hence you want the folder 'ShadersIOS' to appear in output as 'Shaders'.

data.title: MSI installer is missing the SharpDX.WP8.winmd file for x86 & ARM
data.body:
In debugging the issue with the Windows Phone template, the issue simply appears to be a missing file in the MonoGame installer folder

> SharpDX.WP8.winmd

This is not copied from the installer in to the  folders for 
- MonoGame\Assemblies\WindowsPhone\x86
- MonoGame\Assemblies\WindowsPhone\ARM

I've checked the file exists in the ThirdParty SharpDX folder for Windows Phone 8.0 for both platforms.

So the MSI installer creator just needs BOTH files adding for x86 and ARM for the WindowsPhone platform to correct the issue.

I don't think this config is held in the source but on TeamCity. Correct me if I'm wrong and I'll update the necessary config
Ping @tomspilman @dellis1972 

I've tested locally by simply copying the correct SharpDX.WP8.winmd file for each platform in to the installed assemblies folder and ran a project.

So it's not a template issue, just a missing file in the installer.

data.title: Fixed WinRT MediaLibrary cache
data.body: The bug was that we read the cache from the file, then wrote into it, but if the new file is shorter than the old one then the cache file did not become shorter and there were some leftovers which failed to read.

data.title: Triangle strip GetElementCountArray fix
data.body:
The element count calculation for a triangle strip should be primitiveCount + 2.  A triangle is only drawn once three vertices are specified; thereafter an additional triangle is drawn for every additional vertex.

1 triangle    =>  3 vertices
2 triangles  =>  4 vertices
3 triangles  =>  5 vertices
...

thus vertex count = triangle count + 2
